2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.1: And it came to pass, when the Lord would take up Elias into<u>heaven</u>by a whirlwind, that Elias and Eliseus were going from Galgal.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.2: And Elias said to Eliseus: Stay thou here, because the Lord hath sent me as far as Bethel. And Eliseus said to him: As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And when they were come down to Bethel,
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.3: <u>The sons of the prophets</u>, that were at Bethel, came forth to Eliseus, and said to him: Dost thou know that this day the Lord will take away thy master from thee? And he answered: I also know it: hold your peace.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.4: And Elias said to Eliseus: Stay here because the Lord hath sent me to Jericho. And he said: As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee. And when they were come to Jericho,
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.5: The sons of the prophets that were at Jericho, came to Eliseus, and said to him: Dost thou know that this day the Lord will take away thy master from thee? And he said: I also know it: hold your peace.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.6: And Elias said to him: Stay here, because the Lord hath sent me as far as the Jordan. And he said: As the Lord liveth, and as thy soul liveth, I will not leave thee; and they two went on together,
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.7: And fifty men of the sons of the prophets followed them, and stood in sight at a distance: but they two stood by the Jordan.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.8: And Elias took his mantle and folded it together, and struck the waters, and they were divided hither and thither, and they both passed over on dry ground.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.9: And when they were gone over, Elias said to Eliseus: Ask what thou wilt have me to do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Eliseus said: I beseech thee that in me may be thy<u>double spirit</u>.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.10: And he answered: Thou hast asked a hard thing: nevertheless if thou see me when I am taken from thee, thou shalt have what thou hast asked: but if thou see me not, thou shalt not have it.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.11: And as they went on, walking and talking together, behold a fiery chariot, and fiery horses parted them both asunder: and Elias went up by a whirlwind into heaven.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.12: And Eliseus saw him, and cried: My father, my father, the chariot of Israel, and the driver thereof. And he saw him no more: and he took hold of his own garments, and rent them in two pieces.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.13: And he took up the mantle of Elias, that fell from him: and going back, he stood upon the bank of the Jordan,
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.14: And he struck the waters with the mantle of Elias, that had fallen from him, and they were not divided. And he said: Where is now the God of Elias? And he struck the waters, and they were divided, hither and thither, and Eliseus passed over.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.15: And the sons of the prophets at Jericho, who were over against him, seeing it said: The spirit of Elias hath rested upon Eliseus. And coming to meet him,<u>they worshipped him</u>, falling to the ground,
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.16: And they said to him: Behold, there are with thy servants fifty strong men, that can go, and seek thy master, lest perhaps the spirit of the Lord hath taken him up and cast him upon some mountain or into some valley. And he said: Do not send.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.17: But they pressed him, till he consented, and said: Send. And they sent fifty men: and they sought three days but found him not.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.18: And they came back to him: for he abode at Jericho, and he said to them: Did I not say to you: Do not send?
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.19: And the men of the city said to Eliseus: Behold the situation of this city is very good, as thou, my lord, seest: but the waters are very bad, and the ground barren.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.20: And he said: Bring me a new vessel, and put salt into it. And when they had brought it,
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.21: He went out to the spring of the waters, and cast the salt into it, and said: Thus saith the Lord: I have healed these waters, and there shall be no more in them death or barrenness.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.22: And the waters were healed unto this day, according to the word of Eliseus, which he spoke.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.23: And he went up from thence to Bethel: and as he was going up by the way, little boys came out of the city and mocked him, saying: Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.24: And looking back, he saw them, and<u>cursed them</u>in the name of the Lord: and there came forth two bears out of the forest, and tore of them two and forty boys.
2 Kings or 4 Kings__02.25: And from thence he went to mount Carmel, and from thence he returned to Samaria.
